meta.name: description
meta.content: Yonkers Public Schools is committed to challenging our city’s youth to aspire to their highest potential, and to inspire a life-long love of learning.

meta.content: Yonkers, Yonkers Public Schools, School Choice, P-Tech, K12

p.strong: UPDATE 04-16-2020: Governor Cuomo extended school closures through May 15. School expected to resume Mon May 18, 2020 ¡Noticias! Hoy, el Gobernador Cuomo extendió el cierre de escuelas hasta el 15 de mayo. En este momento, se espera que las escuelas abran el 18 de mayo de 2020.

div.h1: Students! Check your school website for lessons and other important information.

span.a: YCPTA Citizenship/Scholarship Awards Ceremony/ Executive Board Meeting

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.span: Board of Education Adopts COVID-19 Grading Systems Protocol

div.p: The Trustees of the Yonkers Board of Education approved suspending the implementation of Board Policy 4710, Grading Systems, and adopted the COVID-19 Grading Systems Protocol.

a.title: Go to comments for Board of Education Adopts COVID-19 Grading Systems Protocol

a.span: BOE to Hold Special Meeting via Zoom Video Conferencing

div.p: In adherence with social distancing requirements, the Board of Education will hold a Special Meeting to discuss extending the COVID-19 Emergency Agreements with bargaining units and any other business brought before the Board at 4PM Thursday, April 2, 2020 via Zoom video conference.

a.title: Go to comments for BOE to Hold Special Meeting via Zoom Video Conferencing

img.alt: Happy student engaged in distance learning

a.span: Spring Break Canceled. Distance Learning & More Continue.

div.p: The Governor’s Executive Order requires all schools in the state to remain closed until April 15, 2020, at least. It also requires Districts to continue distance learning, meals, and childcare during any remaining vacation or snow days, including the upcoming Spring Recess.

a.title: Go to comments for Spring Break Canceled. Distance Learning & More Continue.

a.span: Yonkers Board of Education Holds First Public Meeting Via Video Conferencing

div.p: Yonkers Board of Education President Rev. Steve Lopez opened the Monday, March 23, 2020 Special Meeting of the Board noting, “…we are holding our meeting via video conference.

a.title: Go to comments for Yonkers Board of Education Holds First Public Meeting Via Video Conferencing

img.alt: Yonkers Public Schools to Remain Closed Through March 31, 2020

a.span: Yonkers Public Schools to Remain Closed Through March 31, 2020

div.p: All Yonkers Public Schools will remain closed through Tuesday, March 31, 2020. Schools are expected to reopen on Wednesday, April 1, 2020 with the understanding that schools may have to remain closed.

a.title: Go to comments for Yonkers Public Schools to Remain Closed Through March 31, 2020

img.alt: Yonkers Public Schools Closed for All Students & Staff 3/16-3/17 2020

a.span: Yonkers Public Schools Closed for All Students & Staff 3/16-3/17 2020

div.p: Yonkers Public Schools will be closed Monday and Tuesday, March 16th and 17th for all students and staff. Central Office will be open for administrative staff only

a.title: Go to comments for Yonkers Public Schools Closed for All Students & Staff 3/16-3/17 2020

a.span: Schools Closed for Students Only Fri 3/13/20. Staff to Report for Superintendent's Conference Day

div.p: There are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) in our schools, but the District is preparing for a prolonged closure. Schools will be closed for students on Friday, March 13 for Superintendent’s Conference Day.

a.title: Go to comments for Schools Closed for Students Only Fri 3/13/20. Staff to Report for Superintendent's Conference Day

img.alt: Riverside High School custodian wiping down the door handle to the principal's office.

a.span: Yonkers Public Schools Emergency Continuity Plans

div.p: While there are no confirmed cases of Coronavirus Disease in our schools at this time, we must be prepared. The Yonkers Public Schools Emergency Health and Facilities Management Plan is being supplemented by a Contingency Instructional Plan that will provide students with 14 days of lessons for every grade level.

a.title: Go to comments for Yonkers Public Schools Emergency Continuity Plans

a.span: 3/4/20 Coronavirus Update from the Superintendent of Schools

div.p: Superintendent of Schools Dr. Edwin M. Quezada updates the learning community about Coronavirus, including practical prevention measures..

a.title: Go to comments for 3/4/20 Coronavirus Update from the Superintendent of Schools
Subscribe to RSS Feed - The Latest District News 2019-2020
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - The Latest District News 2019-2020

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Seal of the Yonkers Board of Education

a.span: Yonkers Board of Education Adopts 2019-2020 School District Budget

div.p: The Yonkers Board of Education adopted the 2019-2020 School District Budget at the Wednesday, June 19, 2019 Stated Meeting. By unanimous vote, the Trustees approved a $633,050,499 budget.

a.title: Go to comments for Yonkers Board of Education Adopts 2019-2020 School District Budget

img.alt: Lady Liberty and the Crescent Moon

div.p: The Trustees unanimously adopted a resolution, “to recognize Eid-al-Fitr on the academic calendar of the Yonkers City School District, beginning with the 2019-2020 school year, and continuing each school year thereafter, as an approved religious observance day.

a.title: Go to comments for Eid-al-Fitr Added to Academic Calendar

img.alt: Compostable Trays Replace Polystyrene in Lunchrooms

a.span: Compostable Trays Replace Polystyrene in Lunchrooms

div.p: Mayor Mike Spano, along with Yonkers Board of Education President Rev. Steve Lopez and Superintendent of Schools Dr. Edwin M. Quezada, announced Yonkers Public Schools has replaced all of its polystyrene (known as Styrofoam) food trays with 100% recyclable food trays.

a.title: Go to comments for Compostable Trays Replace Polystyrene in Lunchrooms

a.title: New to the Yonkers Public Schools? Here's what you need to know and do.

li.a: Learn More About The Yonkers Basics
Get a HS Metro Card Application (For Eligible Students)

a.title: Click for useful forms to download
Log into the YPS Instructional Technology Apps with your District network credentials. CLEVER!
Use this link to search the entire Yonkers Public Schools website
Go to this link for the student teaching and internship forms you need

div.p: The Class of 2017 shattered every record, earning an astounding $97.6 million in scholarships, incentives, and financial aid. The young men and women of the Yonkers Public Schools Class of 2017 have proved themselves to be the young adults that colleges and universities want in the Class of 2021.

Today a vibrant learning community of 27,000 students from 100 cultures, backgrounds and nationalities in grades prekindergarten through 12 is challenged by a rigorous core curriculum and innovative programs in 39 schools throughout the City of Yonkers.
Innovation • Inspiration • Excellence for All
Yonkers Public Schools
One Larkin Center
Yonkers, NY 10701
